[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [General: Error Handling] [Partial execution] If a string operation is interrupted mid-execution, can partial state changes violate atomicity guarantees? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_check_utf8()] [Overlong encoding] Does std::str::from_utf8() reject overlong UTF-8 encodings (e.g., encoding ASCII as 2-byte sequences), or can attackers use this to bypass validation? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_check_utf8()] [Surrogate pairs] Does the validation properly reject UTF-16 surrogate pairs (U+D800 to U+DFFF) that are invalid in UTF-8? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_check_utf8()] [Modified UTF-8] Can attackers use modified UTF-8 (with null encoded as 0xC0 0x80) to bypass validation checks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_check_utf8()] [BOM handling] Does the function handle byte order marks (BOM) consistently across validators, or can BOM presence cause consensus issues? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_is_char_boundary()] [Boundary at length] When i equals the string length, does is_char_boundary() handle this edge case correctly or can it panic? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_is_char_boundary()] [Multibyte character splitting] Can attackers query boundaries in the middle of 4-byte UTF-8 characters to cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_is_char_boundary()] [Zero-width characters] How does the function handle zero-width joiners and other combining characters - can they cause incorrect boundary detection? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_sub_string()] [Empty substring] When i==j, does the function return an empty vector correctly or can it cause allocation failures? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_sub_string()] [Full string extraction] When i=0 and j=len, can the function optimize by returning a reference instead of copying, and does this affect determinism? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_sub_string()] [Continuation byte start] If i points to a UTF-8 continuation byte, does the slice panic or silently produce invalid UTF-8? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_index_of()] [Empty pattern] Does str::find() with an empty pattern return 0 (match at start) or None, and is this behavior consistent? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_index_of()] [Pattern longer than string] When pattern.len() > string.len(), does the search handle this efficiently or does it scan unnecessarily? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_index_of()] [Multiple matches] The function returns the first match position - can attackers exploit this to bypass intended validation when multiple matches exist? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Function: native_index_of()] [Case sensitivity] Is pattern matching case-sensitive, and can case-insensitive matching be exploited to bypass security checks in Move contracts? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Integration: AptosVM] [Transaction validation] Can string validation failures in transaction prologue cause validators to reject valid transactions, leading to liveness issues? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Integration: Gas Metering] [Gas schedule updates] When gas schedules are updated via governance, can old transactions with cached gas calculations underpay or overpay? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Integration: State Storage] [String serialization] Can string natives produce output that is inconsistent with state storage serialization, causing state corruption? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Integration: Parallel Execution] [Speculation failure] When Block-STM speculatively executes string operations, can rollback leave residual state that affects subsequent executions? (High)
